content:
I am a beginner in lean and reading through Theorem Proving in Lean 4 book.

At the beginning of the 3rd chapter, there is a code snippet

#check And     -- Prop → Prop → Prop
#check Or      -- Prop → Prop → Prop
#check Not     -- Prop → Prop
#check Implies -- Prop → Prop → Prop

I was trying to follow along by typing them into my VS Code. The first three statement works as expected, but the last one throws an error unknown identifier 'Implies'.

Is this because I am having a different / wrong lean version, or is Implies renamed to something else in the newer version? Thanks!

$ lean -v
Lean (version 4.7.0, aarch64-apple-darwin, commit 6fce8f7d5cd1, Release)
This is a common question about that chapter. If you click the eye icon in the upper right of the code snippet, you can see its definition.
Thanks for the answer! This is the first time I noticed the "eye icon". Just to confirm, is it needed generally for all code snippets, or just for specific versions of lean runtime?
Implies is defined just in this chapter. The paragraph that comes bit later that starts with "moreover, once we make this identification" explains that p → q is what we actually use for implication.
Ying Xiong has marked this topic as resolved.
